decks.notes: The main focus of this Golgari/Jund Garden control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of removal spells, creature destruction, and graveyard hate. The deck also utilizes token generation from cards like Khalni Garden and Lembas to apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of card advantage, board wipes, and efficient removal, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can establish a dominant position on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through a combination of direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing low-cost spells and creatures with high damage potential, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The synergy between cards like Guttersnipe and Fiery Temper maximizes damage output while cards like Grab the Prize provide additional value. The goal is to maintain pressure and finish off the opponent with a burst of damage from cards like Fireblast.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Balustrade Spy combo, utilizing cards like Land Grant and Winding Way to dig through the deck for key pieces. Once Balustrade Spy is on the battlefield, it can mill the entire library, allowing Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Lotleth Giant or Nyxborn Hydra to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Timberwatch Elf and Priest of Titania to generate mana and support the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient card draw and graveyard recursion to execute a game-winning combo.

The deck focuses on quickly generating artifact creatures and sacrificing them for damage or card advantage. It emphasizes a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Myr Enforcer and Galvanic Blast to put pressure on the opponent. The deck also has some graveyard hate with Nihil Spellbomb and synergizes well with sacrificing artifacts for value. The main win condition revolves around using artifacts and sacrificing them for various effects, creating a versatile and explosive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Generous Ent, Gatecreeper Vine, and Overgrown Battlement, while using cards like Balustrade Spy and Dread Return to combo off and mill the opponent's entire library in one turn. Lotus Petal and Land Grant help to fix your mana and provide additional resources. Combined with cards like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way, you can quickly assemble your combo pieces. Masked Vandal and Mesmeric Fiend provide disruption for your opponent, while Lotleth Giant can finish off the game once their library is empty.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and control the board through counterspells and removal while maintaining card advantage with draw spells. It also utilizes creatures with enters-the-battlefield abilities to generate additional value and apply pressure. The deck focuses on controlling the game tempo, protecting key pieces, and ultimately out-valuing the opponent to secure a victory. Additionally, it includes lands that provide color fixing and the ability to recur cards from the graveyard, adding another layer of strategic depth to the gameplay.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through utilizing Gates as mana fixers and providing extra value. The key strategy is to remove threats with removal spells like Journey to Nowhere and counterspells, while also generating card advantage with cards like Squadron Hawk and LÃ³rien Revealed. Additionally, the deck aims to stabilize the board with defensive creatures like Sacred Cat and Outlaw Medic. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and slowly grind them down while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the Urzatron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans. The deck utilizes cards like Mnemonic Wall and Ghostly Flicker to recycle valuable spells and abilities, while also including counter spells like Prohibit and Remove Soul to handle threats. The deck also includes ways to gain life and draw cards to ensure its longevity in the game. Overall, the key strategy is to establish dominance through resource management and control.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive strategy focused on utilizing artifacts. By playing low-cost artifacts such as Myr Enforcer and Mistvault Bridge and combining them with cards like Galvanic Blast and Krark-Clan Shaman, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and consistently. The inclusion of cards like Blood Fountain and Nihil Spellbomb help maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck is built to apply pressure and finish off the opponent swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of sacrifice effects, removal spells, and card draw to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. Cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Fanatical Offering can be used to sacrifice creatures for value, while cards like Makeshift Munitions and Eviscerator's Insight can deal direct damage to the opponent. Duress and Nihil Spellbomb provide disruption against the opponent's spells and graveyard strategies. Overall, this deck aims to maintain aggression and resource advantage to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing walls to generate mana and protect the player, while also setting up a combo with Freed from the Real and a creature that taps for mana to create infinite mana. This combo can be used to cast Reaping the Graves to return key pieces of the combo from the graveyard and win the game. The deck also includes card draw and creature search spells to help find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with efficient creatures and generate card advantage through various means such as sacrificing artifacts and recurring creatures from the graveyard. By attacking aggressively and maintaining steady card advantage, the Orzhov Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes various ways to gain life to help survive against aggressive opponents while staying on the offensive.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using burn spells and aggressive creatures. It aims to control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, while also utilizing cards like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather to deal damage directly to the opponent. Faithless Looting is used to dig through the deck and find key cards, while Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery help generate card advantage. This deck is designed to quickly take control of the game and put pressure on the opponent to win as fast as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and hand disruption, while also generating value through card draw and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to dominate the board with resilient threats like Writhing Chrysalis and Troll of Khazad-dÃ»m, while also utilizing sacrifice synergies with Fanatical Offering. Pulse of Murasa and Lembas provide additional lifegain to outlast aggressive decks, while Nihil Spellbomb ensures graveyard hate against recursive strategies. The deck's mana base is designed to enable consistent casting of its spells while also providing utility lands like Khalni Garden for additional value.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy through counter spells, card draw, and removal spells. By consistently countering threats and using card advantage to maintain control of the board, this deck aims to overpower the opponent and eventually win the game. The creatures included provide additional value and support to the control strategy, helping to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. With a heavy emphasis on blue spells and card selection, this deck is designed to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Elf creatures while generating mana through cards like Priest of Titania and Llanowar Elves. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to refill the hand with more Elf creatures, while Timberwatch Elf can boost the power of the team. Masked Vandal provides utility by removing problematic artifacts or enchantments, while Wellwisher helps to gain life. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and outpace the opponent in a fast-paced Pauper 1 vs 1 format.
